tosdr.case: This service can use your content for all their existing and future services
tosdr.tldr:
As per the Grammarly's "Terms of Service and License Agreement," accessed 2018-10-31, "By uploading or entering any User Content, you give Grammarly (and those it works with) a nonexclusive, worldwide, royalty-free and fully-paid, transferable and sublicensable, perpetual, and irrevocable license to copy, store and use your User Content (and, if you are an Authorized User, your Enterprise Subscriber’s User Content) in connection with the provision of the Software and the Services and to improve the algorithms underlying the Software and the Services."

A perpetual, irrevocable license that is transferable and sublicensable use user content in a vague way isn't necessary. (The "provision of the Software and the Services" isn't defined or limited.)
